head.title: Nation's Largest Hauler Cuts Back on City Trash

hedline.hl1: Nation's Largest Hauler Cuts Back on City Trash

block.p: Saying that collecting trash in parts of Queens, Staten Island and Manhattan is not profitable, Waste Management is dropping 10 percent of its commercial customers in New York City. The move comes as prices for trash hauling are rising and as locally owned, independent companies are regaining some of the market share lost to national haulers, which moved into the city as part of the Giuliani administration's effort to combat organized crime. Article, Page B2.
